title: Search for exclusive Higgs and Z boson decays to ╧ò ╬│ and ╧ü ╬│ with the ATLAS detector
abstract: A search for the exclusive decays of the Higgs and Z bosons to a ╧ò or ╧ü meson and a photon is performed with a pp collision data sample corresponding to an integrated luminosity of up to 35. 6 fbΓêÆ 1 collected at TeV with the ATLAS detector at the CERN Large Hadron Collider. These decays have been suggested as a probe of the Higgs boson couplings to light quarks. No significant excess of events is observed above the background, as expected from the Standard Model. Upper limits at 95% confidence level were obtained on the branching fractions of the Higgs boson decays to ╧ò╬│ and ╧ü╬│ of 4. 8├ù 10ΓêÆ 4 and 8. 8├ù 10ΓêÆ 4, respectively. The corresponding 95% confidence level upper limits for the Z boson decays are 0. 9├ù 10ΓêÆ 6 and 25├ù 10ΓêÆ 6 for ╧ò╬│ and ╧ü╬│, respectively.

title: Measurement of the differential cross section  in elastic  scattering at
abstract: We present a measurement of the elastic differential cross section d ╧â (p pΓåÆ p p)/d t as a function of the four-momentum-transfer squared t. The data sample corresponds to an integrated luminosity ofΓëê 31 nbΓêÆ 1 collected with the D0 detector using dedicated Tevatron p p Collider operating conditions at s= 1.96 TeV and covers the range 0.26<| t|< 1.2 GeV 2. For| t|< 0.6 GeV 2, d ╧â/d t is described by an exponential function of the form A eΓêÆ b| t| with a slope parameter b= 16.86┬▒0.10 (stat)┬▒0.20 (syst) GeVΓêÆ 2. A change in slope is observed at| t|Γëê 0.6 GeV 2, followed by a more gradual| t| dependence with increasing values of| t|.

title: Measurement of the ╬▓ΓÇô╬╜ correlation coefficient a╬▓╬╜ in the ╬▓ decay of trapped 6He+ ions
abstract: We have measured the ╬▓-╬╜ angular correlation in the ╬▓ decay of 6 He+ ions using a transparent Paul trap. The 6 He+ ions, produced at GANIL, were first cooled and bunched before being injected in the LPCTrap setup. The angular correlation was inferred from the time of flight of recoil nuclei detected in coincidence with the ╬▓ particles. The detection system gives access to the full ╬▓ decay kinematics, providing means to check the data reliability and to reject a large fraction of background. We find a ╬▓╬╜=ΓêÆ 0.3335 (73) stat (75) syst, in agreement with the standard model prediction for a pure GamowΓÇôTeller transition.

title: ATLAS offline data quality monitoring
abstract: The ATLAS experiment at the Large Hadron Collider reads out 100 Million electronic channels at a rate of 200 Hz. Before the data are shipped to storage and analysis centres across the world, they have to be checked to be free from irregularities which render them scientifically useless. Data quality offline monitoring provides prompt feedback from full first-pass event reconstruction at the Tier-0 computing centre and can unveil problems in the detector hardware and in the data processing chain. Detector information and reconstructed proton-proton collision event characteristics are distilled into a few key histograms and numbers which are automatically compared with a reference. The results of the comparisons are saved as status flags in a database and are published together with the histograms on a web server. They are inspected by a 24/7 shift crew who can notify on-call experts in case of problems and in┬áΓÇª

title: Measurement of the tt production cross section and top quark mass extraction using dilepton events in pp collisions
abstract: We present a measurement of the top quark pair production cross section in p p┬» collisions at s= 1.96 TeV using approximately 1 fbΓêÆ 1 collected with the D├ÿ detector. We consider decay channels containing two high p T charged leptons where one lepton is identified as an electron or a muon while the other lepton can be an electron, a muon or a hadronically decaying ╧ä lepton. For a mass of the top quark of 170 GeV, the measured cross section is 7.5ΓêÆ 1.0+ 1.0 (stat)ΓêÆ 0.6+ 0.7 (syst)ΓêÆ 0.5+ 0.6 (lumi) pb. Using Γäô╧ä events only, we measure: ╧â t t┬»├ù B (t t┬»ΓåÆ Γäô ╧ä b b┬»)= 0.13ΓêÆ 0.08+ 0.09 (stat)ΓêÆ 0.06+ 0.06 (syst)ΓêÆ 0.02+ 0.02 (lumi) pb. Comparing the measured cross section as a function of the mass of the top quark with a partial next-to-next-to leading order Quantum Chromodynamics theoretical prediction, we extract a mass of the top quark of 171.5ΓêÆ 8.8+ 9.9 GeV, in agreement with direct measurements.

title: Branching fractions for transitions of  to
abstract: We report determination of branching fractions for the decays ╧ê (2 S)ΓåÆ h+ J/╧ê, where h= any, ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ, ╧Ç 0 ╧Ç 0, ╬╖, ╧Ç 0, and ╬│ ╬│ through ╧ç c 0, 1, 2. These measurements use 27M ╧ê (2 S) decays produced in e+ eΓêÆ collision data collected with the CLEO detector. The resulting branching fractions and ratios thereof improve upon previously achieved precision in all cases, and in combination with other measurements permit determination of B (╧ç c JΓåÆ ╬│ J/╧ê) and B (╧ê (2 S)ΓåÆ light hadrons).

title: Measurement of the ratios of the Z/╬│Γêù+Γ⌐╛ n jet production cross sections to the total inclusive Z/╬│Γêù cross section in pp┬» collisions at s= 1.96 TeV
abstract: We present a study of events with Z bosons and associated jets produced at the Fermilab Tevatron collider in p p┬» collisions at a center of mass energy of 1.96 TeV. The data sample consists of nearly 14 000 Z/╬│ΓêùΓåÆ e+ eΓêÆ candidates corresponding to an integrated luminosity of 0.4 fbΓêÆ 1 collected with the D├ÿ detector. Ratios of the Z/╬│Γêù+Γ⌐╛ n jet cross sections to the total inclusive Z/╬│Γêù cross section have been measured for n= 1ΓÇô4 jets, and found to be in good agreement with a next-to-leading order QCD calculation and with a tree-level QCD prediction with parton shower simulation and hadronization.

title: Measurement of  using  mesons
abstract: Knowledge of the B s decay fraction of the ╬Ñ (5 S) resonance, f S, is important for B s meson studies at the ╬Ñ (5 S) energy. Using a data sample collected by the CLEO III detector at CESR consisting of 0.423 fbΓêÆ 1 on the ╬Ñ (5 S) resonance, 6.34 fbΓêÆ 1 on the ╬Ñ (4 S) and 2.32 fbΓêÆ 1 in the continuum below the ╬Ñ (4 S), we measure B (╬Ñ (5 S)ΓåÆ ╧ò X)=(13.8┬▒0.7ΓêÆ 1.5+ 2.3)% and B (╬Ñ (4 S)ΓåÆ ╧ò X)=(7.1┬▒0.1┬▒0.6)%; the ratio of the two rates is (1.9┬▒0.1ΓêÆ 0.2+ 0.3). This is the first measurement of the ╧ò meson yield from the ╬Ñ (5 S). Using these rates, and a model dependent estimate of B (B sΓåÆ ╧ò X), we determine f S=(24.6┬▒2.9ΓêÆ 5.3+ 11.0)%. We also update our previous independent measurement of f S made using the inclusive D s yields to now be (16.8┬▒2.6ΓêÆ 3.4+ 6.7)%, due to a better estimate of the number of hadronic events. We also report the total ╬Ñ (5 S) hadronic cross section above continuum to be ╧â (e+ eΓêÆΓåÆ ╬Ñ (5 S))=(0┬áΓÇª

title: Measurement of jet pT correlations in Pb+ Pb and pp collisions at sNN= 2.76 TeV with the ATLAS detector
abstract: Measurements of dijet p T correlations in Pb+ Pb and pp collisions at a nucleonΓÇônucleon centre-of-mass energy of s NN= 2.76 TeV are presented. The measurements are performed with the ATLAS detector at the Large Hadron Collider using Pb+ Pb and pp data samples corresponding to integrated luminosities of 0.14 nbΓêÆ 1 and 4.0 pbΓêÆ 1, respectively. Jets are reconstructed using the anti-k t algorithm with radius parameter values R= 0.3 and R= 0.4. A background subtraction procedure is applied to correct the jets for the large underlying event present in Pb+ Pb collisions. The leading and sub-leading jet transverse momenta are denoted p T 1 and p T 2. An unfolding procedure is applied to the two-dimensional (p T 1, p T 2) distributions to account for experimental effects in the measurement of both jets. Distributions of (1/N) d N/d x J, where x J= p T 2/p T 1, are presented as a function of p T 1 and collision centrality┬áΓÇª

title: Measurement of jet charge in dijet events from   collisions with the ATLAS detector
abstract: The momentum-weighted sum of the charges of tracks associated to a jet is sensitive to the charge of the initiating quark or gluon. This paper presents a measurement of the distribution of momentum-weighted sums, called jet charge, in dijet events using 20.3 fbΓêÆ 1 of data recorded with the ATLAS detector at s= 8 TeV in p p collisions at the LHC. The jet charge distribution is unfolded to remove distortions from detector effects and the resulting particle-level distribution is compared with several models. The p T dependence of the jet charge distribution average and standard deviation are compared to predictions obtained with several leading-order and next-to-leading-order parton distribution functions. The data are also compared to different Monte Carlo simulations of QCD dijet production using various settings of the free parameters within these models. The chosen value of the strong coupling constant used to┬áΓÇª

title: Measurement of transverse energyΓÇôenergy correlations in multi-jet events in pp collisions at s= 7TeV using the ATLAS detector and determination of the strong coupling constant┬áΓÇª
abstract: High transverse momentum jets produced in pp collisions at a centre of mass energy of 7 TeV are used to measure the transverse energyΓÇôenergy correlation function and its associated azimuthal asymmetry. The data were recorded with the ATLAS detector at the LHC in the year 2011 and correspond to an integrated luminosity of 158 pbΓêÆ 1. The selection criteria demand the average transverse momentum of the two leading jets in an event to be larger than 250 GeV. The data at detector level are well described by Monte Carlo event generators. They are unfolded to the particle level and compared with theoretical calculations at next-to-leading-order accuracy. The agreement between data and theory is good and provides a precision test of perturbative Quantum Chromodynamics at large momentum transfers. From this comparison, the strong coupling constant given at the Z boson mass is determined to be ╬▒ s (m Z┬áΓÇª

title: Search for the Standard Model Higgs boson decay to ╬╝+ ╬╝ΓêÆ with the ATLAS detector
abstract: A search is reported for Higgs boson decay to ╬╝+ ╬╝ΓêÆ using data with an integrated luminosity of 24.8 fbΓêÆ 1 collected with the ATLAS detector in pp collisions at s= 7 and 8 TeV at the CERN Large Hadron Collider. The observed dimuon invariant mass distribution is consistent with the Standard Model background-only hypothesis in the 120ΓÇô150 GeV search range. For a Higgs boson with a mass of 125.5 GeV, the observed (expected) upper limit at the 95% confidence level is 7.0 (7.2) times the Standard Model expectation. This corresponds to an upper limit on the branching ratio BR (HΓåÆ ╬╝+ ╬╝ΓêÆ) of 1.5├ù 10ΓêÆ 3.

title: Measurement of the  Production Cross Section and Limits on Anomalous  and  Couplings in  Collisions at
abstract: We present the first observation of the Z ╬│ΓåÆ ╬╜ ╬╜ ╬│ process at the Fermilab Tevatron at 5.1 standard deviations significance, based on 3.6 fbΓêÆ 1 of integrated luminosity collected with the D0 detector at the Fermilab Tevatron p p Collider at s= 1.96 TeV. The measured Z ╬│ production cross section multiplied by the branching fraction of ZΓåÆ ╬╜ ╬╜ is 32┬▒9 (stat+ syst)┬▒2 (lumi) fb for the photon E T> 90 GeV. It is in agreement with the standard model prediction of 39┬▒4 fb. We set limits on anomalous trilinear Z ╬│ ╬│ and Z Z ╬│ gauge boson couplings, most of which are the most restrictive to date.

title: Study of , , , and  in tagged decays of the  resonance
abstract: Using ╧ê (3770)ΓåÆ D D events collected with the CLEO-c detector at the Cornell e+ eΓêÆ storage ring, tagged by fully reconstructing one D meson in a hadronic decay mode, we measure absolute branching fractions and differential decay rates for D 0ΓåÆ ╧ÇΓêÆ e+ ╬╜ e, D+ΓåÆ ╧Ç 0 e+ ╬╜ e, D 0ΓåÆ KΓêÆ e+ ╬╜ e, and D+ΓåÆ K 0 e+ ╬╜ e. The measured decay rates are used to study semileptonic form factors governing these transitions and to test unquenched Lattice QCD (LQCD) calculations. We average our results with previously published CLEO-c measurements of the same quantities using a neutrino reconstruction technique. Combining LQCD calculations of form factor absolute normalizations f+(0) and measurements of f+ ╧Ç (0)| V c d| and f+ K (0)| V c s|, we find| V c d|= 0.222 (8)(3)(23) and| V c s|= 1.018 (10)(8)(106), where the uncertainties are statistical, experimental systematic, and from LQCD, respectively.

title: Observation of  Decays to  and
abstract: Using ╧ê (2 S)ΓåÆ ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ J/╧ê, J/╧êΓåÆ ╬│ ╬╖ΓÇ▓ events acquired with the CLEO-c detector at the CESR e+ eΓêÆ collider, we make the first observations of the decays ╬╖ΓÇ▓ΓåÆ ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ ╧Ç 0 and ╬╖ΓÇ▓ΓåÆ ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ e+ eΓêÆ, measuring absolute branching fractions (37ΓêÆ 9+ 11┬▒4)├ù 10ΓêÆ 4 and (25ΓêÆ 9+ 12┬▒5)├ù 10ΓêÆ 4, respectively. For ╬╖ΓÇ▓ΓåÆ ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ ╧Ç 0, this result probes the mechanism of isospin violation and the roles of ╧Ç 0/╬╖/╬╖ΓÇ▓-mixing and final state rescattering in strong decays. We also set upper limits on branching fractions for ╬╖ΓÇ▓ decays to ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ ╬╝+ ╬╝ΓêÆ, 2 (╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ), ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ 2 ╧Ç 0, 2 (╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ) ╧Ç 0, 3 (╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ), and invisible final states.

title: ATLAS liquid argon calorimeter back end electronics
abstract: The Liquid Argon calorimeters play a central role in the ATLAS (A Toroidal LHC Apparatus) experiment. The environment at the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) imposes strong constraints on the detectors readout systems. In order to achieve very high precision measurements, the detector signals are processed at various stages before reaching the Data Acquisition system (DAQ). Signals from the calorimeter cells are received by on-detector Front End Boards (FEB), which sample the incoming pulse every 25ns and digitize it at a trigger rate of up to 75~kHz. Off-detector Read Out Driver (ROD) boards further process the data and send reconstructed quantities to the DAQ while also monitoring the data quality. In this paper, the ATLAS Liquid Argon electronics chain is described first, followed by a detailed description of the off-detector readout system. Finally, the tests performed on the system are summarized.

title: Observation of
abstract: From e+ eΓêÆ collision data acquired with the CLEO-c detector at CESR, we search for the non-D D decays ╧ê (3770)ΓåÆ ╬│ ╧ç c J, with ╧ç c J reconstructed in four exclusive decays modes containing charged pions and kaons. We report the first observation of such decays for J= 0 with a branching ratio of (0.73┬▒0.07┬▒0.06)%. The rates for different J are consistent with the expectations assuming ╧ê (3770) is predominantly a 1 3 D 1 state of charmonium, but only if relativistic corrections are applied.

title: Direct Search for Dirac Magnetic Monopoles in  Collisions at
abstract: We search for pair-produced Dirac magnetic monopoles in 35.7 pbΓêÆ 1 of proton-antiproton collisions at s= 1.96 TeV with the Collider Detector at Fermilab (CDF). We find no monopole candidates corresponding to a 95% confidence-level cross-section limit ╧â< 0.2 pb for a monopole with mass between 200 and 700 GeV/c 2. Assuming a Drell-Yan pair-production mechanism, we set a mass limit m> 360 GeV/c 2.

title: Search for neutralino production in Z decays
abstract: Limits on Z decay branching ratios into neutralinos are reported. They were obtained from searches for monojets, acoplanar jets, acoplanar lepton pairs, single photons and acoplanar photon pairs as signaturs for the reactions e+e- ΓåÆ ╧ç╧çΓÇ▓ and e+e- ΓåÆ ╧ç╧çΓÇ▓, where ╧ç is the lightest neutralino and ╧çΓÇ▓ any heavier one. The data sample used for these searches corresponds to about 23 000 events of Z decay into multihadrons, collected at LEP by the ALEPH detector for centre of mass energies at and near the Z peak. The results obtained are used to restrict the parameter space of the minimal supersymmetric standard model.

title: Measurement of the production cross section of prompt J/╧ê mesons in association with a W ┬▒ boson in pp collisions at  = 7 TeV with the ATLAS detector
abstract: The process ppΓåÆ W┬▒J/╧ê provides a powerful probe of the production mechanism of charmonium in hadronic collisions, and is also sensitive to multiple parton interactions in the colliding protons. Using the 2011 ATLAS dataset of 4.5 fbΓêÆ 1 of= 7 TeV pp collisions at the LHC, the first observation is made of the production of W┬▒+ prompt J/╧ê events in hadronic collisions, using W┬▒ΓåÆ ╬╝╬╜ ╬╝ and J/╧êΓåÆ ╬╝+ ╬╝ΓêÆ. A yield of W┬▒+ prompt J/╧ê events is observed, with a statistical significance of 5.1╧â. The production rate as a ratio to the inclusive W┬▒boson production rate is measured, and the double parton scattering contribution to the cross section is estimated.

title: Measurements of  and  Production in  Final States in  Collisions
abstract: We study W W and W Z production with Γäô ╬╜ q q (Γäô= e, ╬╝) final states using data collected by the D0 detector at the Fermilab Tevatron Collider corresponding to 4.3 fbΓêÆ 1 of integrated luminosity from p p collisions at s= 1.96 TeV. Assuming the ratio between the production cross sections ╧â (W W) and ╧â (W Z) as predicted by the standard model, we measure the total W V (V= W, Z) cross section to be ╧â (W V)= 19.6ΓêÆ 3.0+ 3.2 pb and reject the background-only hypothesis at a level of 7.9 standard deviations. We also use b-jet discrimination to separate the W Z component from the dominant W W component. Simultaneously fitting W W and W Z contributions, we measure ╧â (W W)= 15.9ΓêÆ 3.2+ 3.7 pb and ╧â (W Z)= 3.3ΓêÆ 3.3+ 4.1 pb, which is consistent with the standard model predictions.

title: Search for anomalous production of diphoton events with missing transverse energy at CDF and limits on gauge-mediated supersymmetry-breaking models
abstract: We present the results of a search for anomalous production of diphoton events with large missing transverse energy using the Collider Detector at Fermilab. In 202 p bΓêÆ 1 of p p collisions at s= 1.96 T e V we observe no candidate events, with an expected standard model background of 0.27┬▒0.07 (s t a t)┬▒0.10 (s y s t) events. The results exclude a lightest chargino of mass less than 167 G e V/c 2, and lightest neutralino of mass less than 93 G e V/c 2 at 95% CL in a gauge-mediated supersymmetry-breaking model with a light gravitino.

title: Observation of  Final States from  Decays and  Annihilation
abstract: Using CLEO data collected from CESR e+ eΓêÆ collisions at the ╧ê (2 S) resonance and nearby continuum at s= 3.67 G e V, we report the first significantly nonzero measurements of light vector-pseudoscalar hadron pair production (including ╧ü ╧Ç, ╧ë ╧Ç, ╧ü ╬╖, and K* 0 K 0) and the ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ ╧Ç 0 final state, both from ╧ê (2 S) decays and direct e+ eΓêÆ annihilation.

title: Search for  violation in
abstract: We report on a search for C P violation in the decay of D 0 and D 0 to K S 0 ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ. The data come from an integrated luminosity of 9.0 f bΓêÆ 1 of e+ eΓêÆ collisions at sΓëê 10 G e V recorded with the CLEO II. V detector. The resonance substructure of this decay is well described by ten quasi-two-body decay channels plus a small nonresonant component. We observe no evidence for C P violation in the amplitudes that describe the decay D 0ΓåÆ K S 0 ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ.

title: Measurement of the B-meson inclusive semileptonic branching fraction and electron-energy moments
abstract: We report a new measurement of the B-meson semileptonic decay momentum spectrum that has been made with a sample of 9.4 fbΓêÆ 1 of e+ eΓêÆ data collected with the CLEO II detector at the ╬Ñ (4 S) resonance. Electrons from primary semileptonic decays and secondary charm decays were separated by using charge and angular correlations in ╬Ñ (4 S) events with a high-momentum lepton and an additional electron. We determined the semileptonic branching fraction to be B (BΓåÆ Xe+ ╬╜ e)=(10.91┬▒0.09┬▒0. 2 4)% from the normalization of the electron-energy spectrum. We also measured the moments of the electron-energy spectrum with minimum energies from 0.6 to 1.5 GeV.

title: A measurement of the ╧ä mass and the first CPT test with ╧ä leptons
abstract: We measure the mass of the ╧ä to be 1775.1┬▒1.6(mcnstat.)┬▒1.0(mcnsys.)┬áMeV using ╧ä from Z0 decays. To test CPT invariance we compare the masses of the positively and negatively charged ╧ä. The relative mass difference is found to be smaller than 3.0├ù10ΓêÆ3 at the 90% confidence level.

title: A Measurement of the b baryon lifetime
abstract: In 451 000 hadronic Z0 decays, recorded with the ALEPH detector at LEP, the yields of ╬¢ΓäôΓêÆ and ╬¢Γäô+ combinations are measured. Semileptonic decays of b baryons result in a signal of 122┬▒ 18 (stat.)ΓêÆ23+22 (syst.) ╬¢ΓäôΓêÆ combinations. From a fit to the impact parameter distributions of the leptons in the ╬¢ΓäôΓêÆ sample, the lifetime of b baryons is measured to be 1.12ΓêÆ0.29+0.32 (stat.) ┬▒0.16 (syst.) ps.

title: Search for Higgs bosons produced via vector-boson fusion and decaying into bottom quark pairs in   collisions with the ATLAS detector
abstract: A search for the b b decay of the Standard Model Higgs boson produced through vector-boson fusion is presented. Three mutually exclusive channels are considered: two all-hadronic channels and a photon-associated channel. Results are reported from the analysis of up to 30.6 fbΓêÆ 1 of p p data at s= 13 TeV collected with the ATLAS detector at the LHC. The measured signal strength relative to the Standard Model prediction from the combined analysis is 2. 5ΓêÆ 1.3+ 1.4 for inclusive Higgs boson production and 3. 0ΓêÆ 1.6+ 1.7 for vector-boson fusion production only.

title: First determination of the CP content of DΓåÆ ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ ╧Ç0 and DΓåÆ K+ KΓêÆ ╧Ç0
abstract: Abstract Quantum-correlated ╧ê (3770)ΓåÆ D D┬» decays collected by the CLEO-c experiment are used to perform first measurements of F+, the fractional CP-even content of the self-conjugate decays DΓåÆ ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ ╧Ç 0 and DΓåÆ K+ KΓêÆ ╧Ç 0. Values of 0.968┬▒0.017┬▒0.006 and 0.731┬▒0.058┬▒0.021 are obtained for ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ ╧Ç 0 and K+ KΓêÆ ╧Ç 0, respectively. It is demonstrated how modes of this sort can be cleanly included in measurements of the unitarity triangle angle ╬│ using BΓêôΓåÆ D KΓêô decays. The high CP-even content of DΓåÆ ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ ╧Ç 0, in particular, makes this a promising mode for improving the precision on ╬│.

title: Improved measurement of absolute hadronic branching fractions of the  meson
abstract: The branching fractions of D s┬▒meson decays serve to normalize many measurements of processes involving charm quarks. Using 586 pbΓêÆ 1 of e+ eΓêÆ collisions recorded at a center of mass energy of 4.17 GeV, we determine absolute branching fractions for 13 D s┬▒decays in 16 reconstructed final states with a double tag technique. In particular we make a precise measurement of the branching fraction B (D sΓåÆ KΓêÆ K+ ╧Ç+)=(5.55┬▒0.14┬▒0.13)%, where the uncertainties are statistical and systematic, respectively. We find a significantly reduced value of B (D sΓåÆ ╧Ç+ ╧Ç 0 ╬╖ΓÇ▓) compared to the world average, and our results bring the inclusively and exclusively measured values of B (D sΓåÆ ╬╖ΓÇ▓ X) into agreement. We also search for C P-violating asymmetries in D s decays and measure the cross section of e+ eΓêÆΓåÆ D s* D s at E cm= 4.17 GeV.

title: Search for Higgs bosons of the minimal supersymmetric standard model in pp╠ä collisions at s= 1.96 TeV
abstract: We report results from searches for neutral Higgs bosons produced in p p┬» collisions recorded by the D0 experiment at the Fermilab Tevatron Collider. We study the production of inclusive neutral Higgs boson in the ╧ä╧ä final state and in association with a b quark in the b╧ä╧ä and bbb final states. These results are combined to improve the sensitivity to the production of neutral Higgs bosons in the context of the minimal supersymmetric standard model (MSSM). The data are found to be consistent with expectation from background processes. Upper limits on MSSM Higgs boson production are set for Higgs boson masses ranging from 90 to 300 GeV. We exclude tan ╬▓> 20ΓÇô30 for Higgs boson masses below 180 GeV. These are the most stringent constraints on MSSM Higgs boson production in p p┬» collisions.

title: Search for a Resonance Decaying into  Boson Pairs in  Collisions
abstract: We present the first search for an electrically charged resonance WΓÇ▓ decaying to a W Z boson pair using 4.1 fbΓêÆ 1 of integrated luminosity collected with the D0 detector at the Fermilab Tevatron p p collider. The W Z pairs are reconstructed through their decays into three charged leptons (Γäô= e, ╬╝). A total of 9 data events is observed in good agreement with the background prediction. We set 95% CL limits on the WΓÇ▓ W Z coupling and on the WΓÇ▓ production cross section multiplied by the branching fractions. We also exclude WΓÇ▓ masses between 188 and 520 GeV within a simple extension of the standard model and set the most restrictive limits to date on low-scale technicolor models.

title: Measurement of prompt photon production in hadronicZ decays
abstract: The production of isolated photons in hadronicZ decays is measured with the ALEPH detector at LEP using a sample of 450 000 hadronic events. The corrected rate is given for several values of the minimum invariant mass squared cut between the photon and the jets. This measurement of final state radiation from the quarks is compared with the predictions of parton shower models JETSET, ARIADNE and HERWIG as well as with the predictions of QCD matrix element calculations.

title: Search for new phenomena in events with a photon and missing transverse momentum in pp collisions at s                      =           13                             TeV with┬áΓÇª
abstract: Results of a search for new phenomena in events with an energetic photon and large missing transverse momentum with the ATLAS experiment at the Large Hadron Collider are reported. The data were collected in proton-proton collisions at a centre-of-mass energy of 13 TeV and correspond to an integrated luminosity of 3.2 fbΓêÆ 1. The observed data are in agreement with the Standard Model expectations. Exclusion limits are presented in models of new phenomena including pair production of dark matter candidates or large extra spatial dimensions. In a simplified model of dark matter and an axial-vector mediator, the search excludes mediator masses below 710 GeV for dark matter candidate masses below 150 GeV. In an effective theory of dark matter production, values of the suppression scale MΓêù up to 570 GeV are excluded and the effect of truncation for various coupling values is reported. For the ADD large┬áΓÇª

title: Simultaneous measurement of forward-backward asymmetry and top polarization in dilepton final states from  production at the Tevatron
abstract: We present a simultaneous measurement of the forward-backward asymmetry and the top-quark polarization in t t production in dilepton final states using 9.7 fbΓêÆ 1 of proton-antiproton collisions at s= 1.96 TeV with the D0 detector. To reconstruct the distributions of kinematic observables we employ a matrix element technique that calculates the likelihood of the possible t t kinematic configurations. After accounting for the presence of background events and for calibration effects, we obtain a forward-backward asymmetry of A t t=(15.0┬▒6.4 (stat)┬▒4.9 (syst))% and a top-quark polarization times spin analyzing power in the beam basis of ╬║ P=(7.2┬▒10.5 (stat)┬▒4.2 (syst))%, with a correlation ofΓêÆ 56% between the measurements. If we constrain the forward-backward asymmetry to its expected standard model value, we obtain a measurement of the top polarization of ╬║ P=(11.3┬▒9.1 (stat)┬▒1.9 (syst))%. If we constrain the top┬áΓÇª

title: Measurement of the  branching fraction and angular amplitudes
abstract: A sample of 114┬▒11 B s 0ΓåÆ J/╧ê KΓêÆ ╧Ç+ signal events obtained with 0.37 fbΓêÆ 1 of p p collisions at s= 7 TeV collected by the LHCb experiment is used to measure the branching fraction and polarization amplitudes of the B s 0ΓåÆ J/╧ê K* 0 decay, with K* 0ΓåÆ KΓêÆ ╧Ç+. The KΓêÆ ╧Ç+ mass spectrum of the candidates in the B s 0 peak is dominated by the K* 0 contribution. Subtracting the nonresonant KΓêÆ ╧Ç+ component, the branching fraction of B s 0ΓåÆ J/╧ê K* 0 is (4.4ΓêÆ 0.4+ 0.5┬▒0.8)├ù 10ΓêÆ 5, where the first uncertainty is statistical and the second is systematic. A fit to the angular distribution of the decay products yields the K* 0 polarization fractions f L= 0.50┬▒0.08┬▒0.02 and fΓêÑ= 0.19ΓêÆ 0.08+ 0.10┬▒0.02.

title: Measurement of the WZΓåÆ Γäô╬╜ΓäôΓäô cross section and limits on anomalous triple gauge couplings in pp┬» collisions at s= 1.96 TeV
abstract: We present a new measurement of the WZΓåÆ Γäô ╬╜ Γäô Γäô (Γäô= e, ╬╝) cross section and limits on anomalous triple gauge couplings. Using 4.1 fbΓêÆ 1 of integrated luminosity of p p┬» collisions at s= 1.96 TeV, we observe 34 WZ candidate events with an estimated background of 6.0┬▒0.4 events. We measure the WZ production cross section to be 3.89ΓêÆ 0.90+ 1.07 pb, in good agreement with the standard model prediction. We find no evidence for anomalous WWZ couplings and set 95% CL limits on the coupling parameters,ΓêÆ 0.077< ╬╗ Z< 0.093 andΓêÆ 0.029< ╬ö ╬║ Z< 0.080 in the HISZ parameterization for a ╬¢= 2 TeV form factor scale. These are the best limits to date obtained from the direct measurement of the WWZ vertex.

title: Absolute branching fraction measurements for exclusive  semileptonic decays
abstract: We measure the absolute branching fractions of D s semileptonic decays where the hadron in the final state is one of ╧ò, ╬╖, ╬╖ΓÇ▓, K S 0, KΓïå 0, and f 0, using 2.8├ù 10 5 e+ eΓêÆΓåÆ D s D sΓïå decays collected in the CLEO-c detector at a center-of-mass energy close to 4170 MeV. We obtain B (D s+ΓåÆ ╧ò e+ ╬╜ e)=(2.29┬▒0.37┬▒0.11)%, B (D s+ΓåÆ ╬╖ e+ ╬╜ e)=(2.48┬▒0.29┬▒0.13)%, B (D s+ΓåÆ ╬╖ΓÇ▓ e+ ╬╜ e)=(0.91┬▒0.33┬▒0.05)%, where the first uncertainties are statistical and the second are systematic. We also obtain B (D s+ΓåÆ K 0 e+ ╬╜ e)=(0.37┬▒0.10┬▒0.02)%, and B (D s+ΓåÆ KΓïå 0 e+ ╬╜ e)=(0.18┬▒0.07┬▒0.01)%, which are the first measurements of Cabibbo suppressed exclusive D s semileptonic decays, and, B (D s+ΓåÆ f 0 e+ ╬╜ e)├ù B (f 0ΓåÆ ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ)=(0.13┬▒0.04┬▒0.01)%. This is the first absolute product branching fraction determination for a semileptonic decay including a scalar meson in the final state.

title: Construction, assembly and tests of the ATLAS electromagnetic end-cap calorimeters
abstract: The construction and the assembly of the two end-caps of the ATLAS liquid argon electromagnetic calorimeter as well as their test and qualification programs are described. The work described here started at the beginning of 2001 and lasted for approximately three years. The results of the qualification tests performed before installation in the LHC ATLAS pit are given. The detectors are now installed in the ATLAS cavern, full of liquid argon and being commissioned. The complete detectors coverage is powered with high voltage and readout.

title: Measurement of the spin density matrix for the ╧▒0, KΓêù 0 (892) and F produced in Z0 decays
abstract: The spin density matrix elements for the ╧▒ 0, KΓêù 0 (892) and F produced in hadronic Z 0 decays are measured in the DELPHI detector. There is no evidence for spin alignment of the KΓêù 0 (892) and F in the region x pΓëñ 0.3 (x p= p p beam), where ╧▒ 00= 0.33┬▒0.05 and ╧▒ 00= 0.30┬▒0.04, respectively. In the fragmentation region, x pΓëÑ 0.4, there is some indication for spin alignment of the ╧▒ 0 and KΓêù 0 (892), since ╧▒ 00= 0.43┬▒0.05 and ╧▒ 00= 0.46┬▒0.08, respectively. These values are compared with those found in meson-induced hadronic reactions. For the F, ╧▒ 00= 0.30┬▒0.04 for x pΓëÑ 0.4 and 0.55┬▒0.10 for x pΓëÑ 0.7. The off-diagonal spin density matrix element ╧▒ 1-1 is consistent with zero in all cases.

title: Measurement of the cross-section for electroweak production of dijets in association with a Z boson in pp collisions at s= 13TeV with the ATLAS detector
abstract: The cross-section for the production of two jets in association with a leptonically decaying Z boson (Zjj) is measured in protonΓÇôproton collisions at a centre-of-mass energy of 13 TeV, using data recorded with the ATLAS detector at the Large Hadron Collider, corresponding to an integrated luminosity of 3.2 fbΓêÆ 1. The electroweak Zjj cross-section is extracted in a fiducial region chosen to enhance the electroweak contribution relative to the dominant DrellΓÇôYan Zjj process, which is constrained using a data-driven approach. The measured fiducial electroweak cross-section is ╧â EW Z j j= 119┬▒16 (s t a t.)┬▒20 (s y s t.)┬▒2 (l u m i.) fb for dijet invariant mass greater than 250 GeV, and 34.2┬▒5.8 (s t a t.)┬▒5.5 (s y s t.)┬▒0.7 (l u m i.) fb for dijet invariant mass greater than 1 TeV. Standard Model predictions are in agreement with the measurements. The inclusive Zjj cross-section is also measured in six different fiducial regions with┬áΓÇª

title: Search for the Higgs boson produced in association with a W boson and decaying to four b-quarks via two spin-zero particles in pp collisions at 13 TeV with the ATLAS detector
abstract: This paper presents a dedicated search for exotic decays of the Higgs boson to a pair of new spin-zero particles,, where the particle a decays to b-quarks and has a mass in the range of 20ΓÇô60 GeV. The search is performed in events where the Higgs boson is produced in association with a boson, giving rise to a signature of a lepton (electron or muon), missing transverse momentum, and multiple jets from b-quark decays. The analysis is based on the full dataset of pp collisions at recorded in 2015 by the ATLAS detector at the CERN Large Hadron Collider, corresponding to an integrated luminosity of 3.2. No significant excess of events above the Standard Model prediction is observed, and a confidence-level upper limit is derived for the product of the production cross section for times the branching ratio for the decay. The upper limit ranges from 6.2 pb for an a-boson mass┬áΓÇª

title: Measurement of CP violation parameters and polarisation fractions in B s 0ΓåÆ J/╧ê K┬»Γêù 0 decays
abstract: The first measurement of CP asymmetries in the decay and an updated measurement of its branching fraction and polarisation fractions are presented. The results are obtained using data corresponding to an integrated luminosity of 3. 0 fbΓêÆ 1 of proton-proton collisions recorded with the LHCb detector at centre-of-mass energies of 7 and 8 TeV. Together with constraints from B 0ΓåÆ J/╧ê ╧ü 0, the results are used to constrain additional contributions due to penguin diagrams in the CP-violating phase ╧ò s, measured through B 0 s decays to charmonium.

title: Amplitude analysis of
abstract: The first flavor-tagged amplitude analysis of the decay D 0 to the self-conjugate final state K+ KΓêÆ ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ is presented. Approximately 3000 signal decays are selected from data acquired by the CLEO II. V, CLEO III, and CLEO-c detectors. The three most significant amplitudes, which contribute to the model that best fits the data, are ╧ò ╧ü 0, K 1 (1270)┬▒KΓêô, and nonresonant K+ KΓêÆ ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ. Separate amplitude analyses of D 0 and D 0 candidates indicate no C P violation among the amplitudes at the level of 5% to 30% depending on the mode. In addition, the sensitivity to the C P-violating parameter ╬│/╧ò 3 from a sample of 2000 B+ΓåÆ D 0 (K+ KΓêÆ ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ) K+ decays, where D is a D 0 or D 0, collected at LHCb or a future flavor facility, is estimated to be (11.3┬▒0.3) using the favored model.

title: Studies of the decays  and
abstract: The first measurements of the coherence factor R K S 0 K ╧Ç and the average strong-phase difference ╬┤ D K S 0 K ╧Ç in D 0ΓåÆ K S 0 KΓêô ╧Ç┬▒decays are reported. These parameters can be used to improve the determination of the unitary triangle angle ╬│ in BΓêÆΓåÆ DKΓêÆ decays, where D is either a D 0 or a D 0 meson decaying to the same final state, and also in studies of charm mixing. The measurements of the coherence factor and strong-phase difference are made using quantum-correlated, fully reconstructed D 0 D 0 pairs produced in e+ eΓêÆ collisions at the ╧ê (3770) resonance. The measured values are R K S 0 K ╧Ç= 0.73┬▒0.08 and ╬┤ D K S 0 K ╧Ç=(8.3┬▒15.2) for an unrestricted kinematic region and R K* K= 1.00┬▒0.16 and ╬┤ D K* K=(26.5┬▒15.8) for a region where the combined K S 0 ╧Ç┬▒invariant mass is within 100 MeV/c 2 of the K*(892)┬▒mass. These results indicate a significant level of coherence in the decay. In addition┬áΓÇª

title: Measurement of Prominent -Decay Branching Fractions
abstract: The decay ╧ê (2 S)ΓåÆ ╬╖ J/╧ê is used to measure, for the first time, all prominent ╬╖-meson branching fractions with the same experiment in the same dataset, thereby providing a consistent treatment of systematics across branching fractions. We present results for ╬╖ decays to ╬│ ╬│, ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ ╧Ç 0, 3 ╧Ç 0, ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ ╬│ and e+ eΓêÆ ╬│, accounting for 99.9% of all ╬╖ decays. The precision of several of the branching fractions and their ratios is improved. Two channels, ╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ ╬│ and e+ eΓêÆ ╬│, show results that differ at the level of three standard deviations from those previously determined.

title: Absolute Branching Fraction Measurements for  and  Inclusive Semileptonic Decays
abstract: We present measurements of the inclusive branching fractions for the decays D+ΓåÆ X e+ ╬╜ e and D 0ΓåÆ X e+ ╬╜ e, using 281 pbΓêÆ 1 of data collected on the ╧ê (3770) resonance with the CLEO-c detector. We find B (D 0ΓåÆ X e+ ╬╜ e)=(6.46┬▒0.17┬▒0.13)% and B (D+ΓåÆ X e+ ╬╜ e)=(16.13┬▒0.20┬▒0.33)%. Using the known D meson lifetimes, we obtain the ratio ╬ô D+ sl/╬ô D 0 sl= 0.985┬▒0.028┬▒0.015, confirming isospin invariance at the level of 3%. The positron momentum spectra from D+ and D 0 have consistent shapes.

title: Search for Neutral Higgs Bosons Decaying to Tau Pairs in  Collisions at
abstract: A search for the production of neutral Higgs bosons ╬ª decaying into ╧ä+ ╧äΓêÆ final states in p p collisions at a center-of-mass energy of 1.96 TeV is presented. The data, corresponding to an integrated luminosity of approximately 325 pbΓêÆ 1, were collected by the D0 experiment at the Fermilab Tevatron Collider. Since no excess compared to the expectation from standard model processes is found, limits on the production cross section times branching ratio are set. The results are combined with those obtained from the D0 search for ╬ª b (b)ΓåÆ b b b (b) and are interpreted in the minimal supersymmetric standard model.

title: Measurement of the production rates of ╬╖ and ╬╖ΓÇ▓ in hadronic Z decays
abstract: The decays ╬╖ ΓåÆ ╬│╬│ and ╬╖ΓÇ▓ ΓåÆ ╬╖╧Ç+╧ÇΓêÆ have been observed in hadronic decays of the Z produced at LEP. The fragmentation functions of both the ╬╖ and ╬╖ΓÇ▓ have been measured. The measured multiplicities for x > 0.1 are 0.298┬▒0.023┬▒0.021 and 0.068┬▒0.016 for ╬╖ and ╬╖ΓÇ▓ respectively. While the fragmentation function for the ╬╖ is fairly well described by the JETSET Monte Carlo, it is found that the production rate of the ╬╖ΓÇ▓ is a factor of four less than the corresponding prediction.

title: A search for pair-produced charged Higgs bosons in Z0 decays
abstract: A search for pair-produced charged Higgs bosons in decays of the Z 0 has been performed using the ALEPH detector at LEP for the decay channels H+ HΓêÆΓåÆ ╬╜ ╧ä ╬╜ ╧ä, H+ HΓêÆΓåÆ ╬╜╧ä cs and H+ HΓêÆΓåÆ c s c s. Searches for two additional decay channels in which cs is replaced by cb were also performed. With 1.17 pbΓêÆ 1 of integrated luminosity, corresponding to about 25 000 hadronic decays of the Z 0, the charged Higgs has been excluded at 95% CL in the mass range 7.6 to 43.0 GeV for BR [H┬▒ΓåÆ ╬╜╧ä]= 100%, 8.3 to 40.6 GeV for BR [H┬▒ΓåÆ ╬╜╧ä]= BR [H┬▒ΓåÆ cs]= 50%, and 14.4 to 35.4 GeV for BR [H┬▒ΓåÆ cs]= 100%. With cs replaced by cb, the charged Higgs has been excluded at 95% CL in the mass range 12.0 to 40.7 GeV for BR [H┬▒ΓåÆ ╬╜╧ä]= BR [H┬▒ΓåÆ cb]= 50%, and 16.2 to 35.7 GeV for BR [H┬▒ΓåÆ cb]= 100%.

title: Inclusive electron production from heavy quarks in e+ eΓêÆ annihilation at 34.6 GeV center of mass energy
abstract: The production of electrons by bottom and charm hadrons has been studied in e+eΓêÆ annihilation at 34.6 GeV center of mass energy. It is observed that the b quark fragmentation function is peaked at large values of the scaling variable z with <zb> = 0.84+0.15 + 0.15ΓêÆ0.10 ΓêÆ 0.11. For c quarks <zc> = 0.57+0.10 + 0.05ΓêÆ0.09 ΓêÆ 0.06 is observed. A forward-backward charge asymmetry of A = ΓêÆ0.25 ┬▒ 0.22 was measured in b production.

title: Search for Higgs and Z Boson Decays to J/╧ê ╬│ and ╧Æ (n S) ╬│ with the ATLAS Detector
abstract: A search for the decays of the Higgs and Z bosons to J/╧ê ╬│ and ╧Æ (n S) ╬│ (n= 1, 2, 3) is performed with p p collision data samples corresponding to integrated luminosities of up to 20.3 fbΓêÆ 1 collected at s= 8 TeV with the ATLAS detector at the CERN Large Hadron Collider. No significant excess of events is observed above expected backgrounds and 95% CL upper limits are placed on the branching fractions. In the J/╧ê ╬│ final state the limits are 1.5├ù 10ΓêÆ 3 and 2.6├ù 10ΓêÆ 6 for the Higgs and Z boson decays, respectively, while in the ╧Æ (1 S, 2 S, 3 S) ╬│ final states the limits are (1.3, 1.9, 1.3)├ù 10ΓêÆ 3 and (3.4, 6.5, 5.4)├ù 10ΓêÆ 6, respectively.

title: Search for s-channel single top-quark production in protonΓÇôproton collisions at s= 8TeV with the ATLAS detector
abstract: This Letter presents a search at the LHC for s-channel single top-quark production in protonΓÇôproton collisions at a centre-of-mass energy of 8 TeV. The analyzed data set was recorded by the ATLAS detector and corresponds to an integrated luminosity of 20.3 fbΓêÆ 1. Selected events contain one charged lepton, large missing transverse momentum and exactly two b-tagged jets. A multivariate event classifier based on boosted decision trees is developed to discriminate s-channel single top-quark events from the main background contributions. The signal extraction is based on a binned maximum-likelihood fit of the output classifier distribution. The analysis leads to an upper limit on the s-channel single top-quark production cross-section of 14.6 pb at the 95% confidence level. The fit gives a cross-section of ╧â s= 5.0┬▒4.3 pb, consistent with the Standard Model expectation.

title: Search for single bΓüÄ-quark production with the ATLAS detector at s= 7 TeV
abstract: The results of a search for an excited bottom-quark bΓüÄ in pp collisions at s= 7 TeV, using 4.7 fbΓêÆ 1 of data collected by the ATLAS detector at the LHC are presented. In the model studied, a single bΓüÄ-quark is produced through a chromomagnetic interaction and subsequently decays to a W boson and a top quark. The search is performed in the dilepton and lepton+ jets final states, which are combined to set limits on bΓüÄ-quark couplings for a range of bΓüÄ-quark masses. For a benchmark with unit size chromomagnetic and Standard Model-like electroweak bΓüÄ couplings, bΓüÄ quarks with masses less than 870 GeV are excluded at the 95% credibility level.

title: Search for  violation in the Dalitz-plot analysis of
abstract: We report on a search for C P asymmetry in the singly Cabibbo-suppressed decay D+ΓåÆ K+ KΓêÆ ╧Ç+ using a data sample of 818 pbΓêÆ 1 accumulated with the CLEO-c detector on the ╧ê (3770) resonance. A Dalitz-plot analysis is used to determine the amplitudes of the intermediate states. We find no evidence for C P violation either in specific two-body amplitudes or integrated over the entire phase space. The C P asymmetry in the latter case is measured to be (ΓêÆ 0.03┬▒0.84┬▒0.29)%.

title: An upper limit on the electron-neutrino flux from the hires detector
abstract: Air-fluorescence detectors such as the High Resolution Fly's Eye (HiRes) detector are very sensitive to upward-going, Earth-skimming ultra-high-energy electron-neutrino-induced showers. This is due to the relatively large interaction cross sections of these high-energy neutrinos and to the Landau-Pomeranchuk-Migdal (LPM) effect. The LPM effect causes a significant decrease in the cross sections for bremsstrahlung and pair production, allowing charged-current electron-neutrino-induced showers occurring deep in the Earth's crust to be detectable as they exit the Earth into the atmosphere. A search for upward-going neutrino-induced showers in the HiRes-II monocular data set has yielded a null result. From an LPM calculation of the energy spectrum of charged particles as a function of primary energy and depth for electron-induced showers in rock, we calculate the shape of the resulting profile of these showers┬áΓÇª

title: Search for Scalar Neutrino Superpartners in  Final States in  Collisions at
abstract: We report a search for R-parity-violating production and decay of sneutrino particles in the e ╬╝ final state with 1.04┬▒0.06 fbΓêÆ 1 of data collected with the D 0 detector at the Fermilab Tevatron Collider in 2002ΓÇô2006. Good agreement between the data and the standard model prediction is observed. With no evidence for new physics, we set limits on the R-parity-violating couplings ╬╗ 311ΓÇ▓ and ╬╗ 312 as a function of the sneutrino mass.

title: Measurement of the  Lifetime in the Exclusive Decay
abstract: We have measured the ╬¢ b lifetime using the exclusive decay ╬¢ bΓåÆ J/╧ê ╬¢, based on 1.2 fbΓêÆ 1 of data collected with the D0 detector during 2002ΓÇô2006. From 171 reconstructed ╬¢ b decays, where the J/╧ê and ╬¢ are identified via the decays J/╧êΓåÆ ╬╝+ ╬╝ΓêÆ and ╬¢ΓåÆ p ╧Ç, we measured the ╬¢ b lifetime to be ╧ä (╬¢ b)= 1.218ΓêÆ 0.115+ 0.130 (stat)┬▒0.042 (syst) ps. We also measured the B 0 lifetime in the decay B 0ΓåÆ J/╧ê (╬╝+ ╬╝ΓêÆ) K S 0 (╧Ç+ ╧ÇΓêÆ) to be ╧ä (B 0)= 1.501ΓêÆ 0.074+ 0.078 (stat)┬▒0.050 (syst) ps, yielding a lifetime ratio of ╧ä (╬¢ b)/╧ä (B 0)= 0.811ΓêÆ 0.087+ 0.096 (stat)┬▒0.034 (syst).

title: Search for Long-Lived Doubly Charged Higgs Bosons in  Collisions at
abstract: We present a search for long-lived doubly charged Higgs bosons (H┬▒┬▒), with signatures of high ionization energy loss and muonlike penetration. We use 292 pbΓêÆ 1 of data collected in p p collisions at s= 1.96 TeV by the CDF II detector at the Fermilab Tevatron. Observing no evidence of long-lived doubly charged particle production, we exclude H L┬▒┬▒and H R┬▒┬▒bosons with masses below 133 GeV/c 2 and 109 GeV/c 2, respectively. In the degenerate case we exclude H┬▒┬▒mass below 146 GeV/c 2. All limits are quoted at the 95% confidence level.

title: The fate of arm veins used for aorta-coronary bypass grafts
abstract: Arm veins have been a common second choice conduit for those patients having insufficient saphenous veins for coronary bypass operations. To define the patency and durability of arm vein grafts, we reviewed our patients with one or more arm vein grafts used for coronary revascularization between 1974 and 1982. A total of 59 patients required at least one arm vein graft and 51 are presently alive. Postoperative arteriograms were obtained in 28 patients. Of 56 arm vein grafts used, 32 (57%) were patent and 24 (43%) had failed at 2 years. Seven of the patent grafts had a localized area of stenosis. Sixteen internal mammary artery grafts also had been used in this group of patients, and 15 (93%) were patent. We conclude that arm vein grafts have a high failure rate and are not as dependable as saphenous vein grafts or internal mammary artery grafts.

title: High pT hadron production in photon-photon collisions
abstract: We have studied the properties of hadron production in photon-photon scattering with tagged photons at the e+ eΓêÆ storage ring PETRA. A tail in the p T distribution of particles consistent with p TΓêÆ 4 has been observed. We show that this tail cannot be due to the hadronic part of the photon. Selected events with high p T particles are found to be consistent with a two-jet structure as expected from a point-like coupling of the photons to quarks. The lowest-order cross section predicted for ╬│╬│ΓåÆ q q, ╧â= 3 ╬ú e q 4┬╖ ╧â ╬│╬│ΓåÆ ╬╝╬╝, is approached from above by the data at large transverse momenta.

title: Search for doubly charged scalar bosons decaying into same-sign W boson pairs with the ATLAS detector
abstract: A search for doubly charged scalar bosons decaying into W boson pairs is presented. It uses a data sample from protonΓÇôproton collisions corresponding to an integrated luminosity of 36.1 fb collected by the ATLAS detector at the LHC at a centre-of-mass energy of 13 TeV in 2015 and 2016. This search is guided by a model that includes an extension of the Higgs sector through a scalar triplet, leading to a rich phenomenology that includes doubly charged scalar bosons. Those bosons are produced in pairs in protonΓÇôproton collisions and decay predominantly into electroweak gauge bosons. Experimental signatures with several leptons, missing transverse energy and jets are explored. No significant deviations from the Standard Model predictions are found. The parameter space of the benchmark model is excluded at 95% confidence level for bosons with masses between 200 and 220 GeV.

title: Search for new phenomena in events containing a same-flavour opposite-sign dilepton pair, jets, and large missing transverse momentum in $$\varvec {\sqrt {s}= 13} $$ s= 13┬áΓÇª
abstract: Two searches for new phenomena in final states containing a same-flavour opposite-sign lepton (electron or muon) pair, jets, and large missing transverse momentum are presented. These searches make use of protonΓÇôproton collision data, collected during 2015 and 2016 at a centre-of-mass energy by the ATLAS detector at the large hadron collider, which correspond to an integrated luminosity of. Both searches target the pair production of supersymmetric particles, squarks or gluinos, which decay to final states containing a same-flavour opposite-sign lepton pair via one of two mechanisms: a leptonically decaying Z boson in the final state, leading to a peak in the dilepton invariant-mass distribution around the Z boson mass; and decays of neutralinos (eg), yielding a kinematic endpoint in the dilepton invariant-mass spectrum. The data are found to be consistent with the Standard Model┬áΓÇª

title: Development of n+-in-p large-area silicon microstrip sensors for very high radiation environments ΓÇô ATLAS12 design and initial results
abstract: We have been developing a novel radiation-tolerant n+-in-p silicon microstrip sensor for very high radiation environments, aiming for application in the high luminosity large hadron collider. The sensors are fabricated in 6┬áin., p-type, float-zone wafers, where large-area strip sensor designs are laid out together with a number of miniature sensors. Radiation tolerance has been studied with ATLAS07 sensors and with independent structures. The ATLAS07 design was developed into new ATLAS12 designs. The ATLAS12A large-area sensor is made towards an axial strip sensor and the ATLAS12M towards a stereo strip sensor. New features to the ATLAS12 sensors are two dicing lines: standard edge space of 910┬á╬╝m and slim edge space of 450┬á╬╝m, a gated punch-through protection structure, and connection of orphan strips in a triangular corner of stereo strips. We report the design of the ATLAS12 layouts and initial┬áΓÇª

title: Study of beauty hadron decays into pairs of charm hadrons
abstract: First observations of the decays ╬¢ b 0ΓåÆ ╬¢ c+ D (s)ΓêÆ are reported using data corresponding to an integrated luminosity of 3 fbΓêÆ 1 collected at 7 and 8 TeV center-of-mass energies in proton-proton collisions with the LHCb detector. In addition, the most precise measurement of the branching fraction B (B s 0ΓåÆ D+ D sΓêÆ) is made and a search is performed for the decays B (s) 0ΓåÆ ╬¢ c+ ╬¢ cΓêÆ. The results obtained are B (╬¢ b 0ΓåÆ ╬¢ c+ DΓêÆ)/B (╬¢ b 0ΓåÆ ╬¢ c+ D sΓêÆ)= 0.042┬▒0.003 (stat)┬▒0.003 (syst),[B (╬¢ b 0ΓåÆ ╬¢ c+ D sΓêÆ) B (B 0ΓåÆ D+ D sΓêÆ)]/[B (╬¢ b 0ΓåÆ ╬¢ c+ ╧ÇΓêÆ) B (B 0ΓåÆ D+ ╧ÇΓêÆ)]= 0.96┬▒0.02 (stat)┬▒0.06 (syst), B (B s 0ΓåÆ D+ D sΓêÆ)/B (B 0ΓåÆ D+ D sΓêÆ)= 0.038┬▒0.004 (stat)┬▒0.003 (syst), B (B 0ΓåÆ ╬¢ c+ ╬¢ cΓêÆ)/B (B 0ΓåÆ D+ D sΓêÆ)< 0.0022 [95% CL], B (B s 0ΓåÆ ╬¢ c+ ╬¢ cΓêÆ)/B (B s 0ΓåÆ D+ D sΓêÆ)< 0.30 [95% CL]. Measurement of the mass of the ╬¢ b 0 baryon relative to the B 0 meson gives M (╬¢ b 0)ΓêÆ M (B 0)= 339.72┬▒0.24 (stat)┬▒0.18 (syst) MeV/c 2. This┬áΓÇª

title: Measurement of the  Asymmetry in  Decays
abstract: A measurement of the C P asymmetry in B 0ΓåÆ K* 0 ╬╝+ ╬╝ΓêÆ decays is presented, based on 1.0 fbΓêÆ 1 of p p collision data recorded by the LHCb experiment during 2011. The measurement is performed in six bins of invariant mass squared of the ╬╝+ ╬╝ΓêÆ pair, excluding the J/╧ê and ╧ê (2 S) resonance regions. Production and detection asymmetries are removed using the B 0ΓåÆ J/╧ê K* 0 decay as a control mode. The integrated C P asymmetry is found to beΓêÆ 0.072┬▒0.040 (stat)┬▒0.005 (syst), consistent with the standard model.

title: Search for Sneutrino Production in  Final States in  of  Collisions at
abstract: We report the results of a search for R parity violating (RPV) interactions leading to the production of supersymmetric sneutrinos decaying into e ╬╝ final states using 5.3 fbΓêÆ 1 of integrated luminosity collected by the D0 experiment at the Fermilab Tevatron Collider. Having observed no evidence for production of e ╬╝ resonances, we set direct bounds on the RPV couplings ╬╗ 311ΓÇ▓ and ╬╗ 312 as a function of sneutrino mass.

title: Investigating and managing pyrexia of unknown origin in adults
abstract: Classic adult pyrexia of unknown origin is fever of 38.3 C or greater for at least 3 weeks with no identified cause after three days of hospital evaluation or three outpatient visits

title: Search for long-lived particles decaying into electron or photon pairs with the D0 detector
abstract: In this Letter we report on a search for long-lived particles that decay into final states with two electrons or photons. Such long-lived particles arise in a variety of theoretical models, such as hidden valleys and supersymmetry with gauge-mediated breaking. By precisely reconstructing the direction of the electromagnetic shower we are able to probe much longer lifetimes than previously explored. We see no evidence of the existence of such long-lived particles and interpret this search as a quasi model-independent limit on their production cross section, as well as a limit on a long-lived fourth generation quark.

title: Search for squarks and gluinos in events with jets and missing transverse energy in pp┬» collisions at s= 1.96 TeV
abstract: The results of a search for squarks and gluinos using data from p p┬» collisions recorded at a center-of-mass energy of 1.96 TeV by the D├ÿ detector at the Fermilab Tevatron Collider are reported. The topologies analyzed consist of acoplanar-jet and multijet events with large missing transverse energy. No evidence for the production of squarks or gluinos was found in a data sample of 310 pbΓêÆ 1. Lower limits of 325 and 241 GeV were derived at the 95% CL on the squark and gluino masses, respectively, within the framework of minimal supergravity with tan ╬▓= 3, A 0= 0, and ╬╝< 0.

title: Workshop on CP Studies andNon-Standard Higgs Physics: CERN, Geneva, Switzerland 14-15 May 2004
abstract: There are many possibilities for new physics beyond the Standard Model that feature non-standard Higgs sectors. These may introduce new sources of CP violation, and there may be mixing between multiple Higgs bosons or other new scalar bosons. Alternatively, the Higgs may be a composite state, or there may even be no Higgs at all. These non-standard Higgs scenarios have important implications for collider physics as well as for cosmology, and understanding their phenomenology is essential for a full comprehension of electroweak symmetry breaking. This report discusses the most relevant theories which go beyond the Standard Model and its minimal, CP-conserving supersymmetric extension: two-Higgs-doublet models and minimal supersymmetric models with CP violation, supersymmetric models with an extra singlet, models with extra gauge groups or Higgs triplets, Little Higgs models, models in extra dimensions, and models with technicolour or other new strong dynamics. For each of these scenarios, this report presents an introduction to the phenomenology, followed by contributions on more detailed theoretical aspects and studies of possible experimental signatures at the LHC and other colliders.

title: Measurement of the absolute luminosity with the ALEPH detector
abstract: We report on the absolute luminosity measurement performed with the ALEPH detector at LEP. The systematic errors of the measurements in 1990 are estimated to be 0.6% (experimental) and 0.3% (theoretical).

title: Asymmetries in single and triple hop are not detrimental to change of direction speed
abstract: Objectives: To determine the impact of between limb asymmetries in hop performance on change of direction speed (CODS). Design and Methods: Twenty-two multisport collegiate athletes (mean┬▒SD; age: 21.8┬▒3.4 years, height: 178.1┬▒6.7 cm, mass: 73.5┬▒7.1 kg) performed three single and triple horizontal hops for distance per limb, followed by three modified 505 and 90 cut CODS trials each side to establish imbalances between right and left, and dominant (D) and non-dominant (ND) limbs. Limb dominance was defined as the limb that produced the furthest hop or faster CODS performance. Results: Paired sample t-tests revealed no significant differences in hop performance and CODS performance between right and left limbs (p> 0.05, gΓëñ 0.11), however, significant differences were observed when comparing D and ND limbs (p< 0.001, g= 0.46-0.61). No significant correlations were observed between hop imbalance and CODS performance (p> 0.05, rΓëñ 0.35). Low agreements (32-55%) were demonstrated between like for like identifications of asymmetry for CODS and hop performance. Conclusions: Imbalances in hop and CODS were present; however, greater hop imbalances were not detrimental to CODS. Furthermore, the D limb for hopping did not necessarily correspond to faster performance from that limb during 180 turns and 90 cuts (plant foot). Collegiate male multi-sport athletes with imbalances within the range reported within this study (Γëñ 15%) should not experience associated CODS detriments.

title: Bis-sulfide bioconjugates for glutathione triggered tumor responsive drug release
abstract: The reaction of bis-sulfone conjugation reagents with disulfide bonds allows the site-specific modification of various peptides and proteins. Herein, we present the intracellular disintegration of bis-sulfide containing somatostatin bioconjugates under controlled, tumor-relevant glutathione levels. GSH responsive release is demonstrated, which offers high potential for designing tumor responsive therapeutics.

title: Measurement of the dijet invariant mass cross section in pp┬» collisions at s= 1.96 TeV
abstract: The inclusive dijet production double differential cross section as a function of the dijet invariant mass and of the largest absolute rapidity of the two jets with the largest transverse momentum in an event is measured in p p┬» collisions at s= 1.96 TeV using 0.7 fbΓêÆ 1 of integrated luminosity collected with the D0 detector at the Fermilab Tevatron Collider. The measurement is performed in six rapidity regions up to a maximum rapidity of 2.4. Next-to-leading order perturbative QCD predictions are found to be in agreement with the data.

title: A measurement of coherent neutral pion production in neutrino neutral current interactions in the NOMAD experiment
abstract: We present a study of exclusive neutral pion production in neutrinoΓÇônucleus Neutral Current interactions using data from the NOMAD experiment at the CERN SPS. The data correspond to 1.44├ù 10 6 muon-neutrino Charged Current interactions in the energy range 2.5Γ⌐╜ E ╬╜Γ⌐╜ 300 GeV. Neutrino events with only one visible ╧Ç 0 in the final state are expected to result from two Neutral Current processes: coherent ╧Ç 0 production, ╬╜+ AΓåÆ ╬╜+ A+ ╧Ç 0 and single ╧Ç 0 production in neutrinoΓÇônucleon scattering. The signature of coherent ╧Ç 0 production is an emergent ╧Ç 0 almost collinear with the incident neutrino while ╧Ç 0's produced in neutrinoΓÇônucleon deep inelastic scattering have larger transverse momenta. In this analysis all relevant backgrounds to the coherent ╧Ç 0 production signal are measured using data themselves. Having determined the backgrounds, and using the ReinΓÇôSehgal model for the coherent ╧Ç 0┬áΓÇª

title: Should the coaches of elite female handball teams focus on collective efficacy or group cohesion?
abstract: The purpose of this study was to examine the direction of the effect between cohesion and collective efficacy in elite female handball teams. A total of 84 female handball players completed 2 questionnaires at 2 time periods during the competitive season (i.e., early and midseason). Relationships were examined across time at an individual level after statistically controlling for previous group performance. Regression analyses including the autoregressive influence indicated that early-season collective efficacy positively predicted variance in midseason individual attractions to the group-task (ATG-T) after controlling for early-season ATG-T scores. In elite female handball teams, findings only supported collective efficacy as an antecedent of task cohesion and suggested that coaches should promote strategies dedicated to foster athletesΓÇÖ beliefs about their team efficacy.

title: Branching-fraction measurements of  decay to baryon-antibaryon final states
abstract: Using 3.08├ù 10 6 ╧ê (2 S) decays observed in e+ eΓêÆ collisions by the CLEO detector, we present the results of a study of the ╧ê (2 S) decaying into baryon-antibaryon final states. We report the most precise measurements of the following eight modes: p p, ╬¢ ╬¢, ╬ú+ ╬ú+(first observation), ╬ú 0 ╬ú 0, ╬₧ΓêÆ ╬₧ΓêÆ, and ╬₧ 0 ╬₧ 0 (first observation), and place upper limits for the modes ╬₧ (1530) 0 ╬₧ (1530) 0 and ╬⌐ΓêÆ ╬⌐ΓêÆ.
